sen.j: この言葉は、弘仁6年（815年）に朝廷が編纂した古代氏族の系譜集『新撰姓氏録』が、皇別（天皇・皇子の子孫）・神別（天津神・国津神の子孫）・諸蕃（朝鮮半島・中国大陸から渡来した人々の子孫）の3種に氏族を分類していることにちなむ造語である。
sen.e: The word "Kobetsu Sekke" is originally coined by "Shinsen Shojiroku"(Newly Complied Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility), the pedigree record of ancient cognate clans edited by the Imperial Court in 815 which classified clans into three types, Kobetsu (descendants of emperors and princes), Shinbetsu (descendants of Amatsukami, meaning heavenly god and Kunitsukami, meaning god of the land), and Shoban (descendants of migrants from Korean Peninsula and the Chinese Continent)

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、兼輝の跡を鷹司房輔の子（一条兼香）が養子に入って継ぎ、昭良の男系は途絶えた。
sen.e: However, the male linage of Akiyoshi died when Kaneka ICHIJO (the child of Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA) succeeded the Ichijo family after Kaneteru.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the male linage of Akiyoshi became extinct when Kaneka ICHIJO (the child of Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA) succeeded the Ichijo family after Kaneteru.
sen.cmt: linage → lineage、 died → became extinct に訂正しました。
sen.e: However, the male linage of Akiyoshi became extinct when Kaneka ICHIJO (the child of Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA) succeeded the Ichijo family after Kaneteru.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、昭良の子（醍醐冬基）が分家して醍醐家を興しており、その男系子孫が現存する。
sen.e: Yet, Fuyumoto Daigo (the son of Akiyoshi ICHIJO) formed the branch family, Daigo family, and his male descendants still exist.
Yet, Fuyumoto DAIGO (the son of Akiyoshi ICHIJO) formed the branch family, Daigo family, and his male descendants still exist.
sen.cmt: Daigo → DAIGO に訂正しました。
sen.e: Yet, Fuyumoto DAIGO (the son of Akiyoshi ICHIJO) formed the branch family, Daigo family, and his male descendants still exist.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 醍醐家からは、明治になって、大日本帝国海軍の軍人となり潜水艦の専門家として名を馳せ中将にまで昇進した醍醐忠重が出た。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, Tadashige DAIGO from the Daigo family participated the Imperial Japanese Navy and was promoted to the vice admiral, with an execellent reputation as the expert of submarines.
In the Meiji period, Tadashige DAIGO from the Daigo family joined the Imperial Japanese Navy and was promoted to the vice admiral, with an excellent reputation as the expert of submarines.
sen.cmt: participated → joined、execellent → excellent に訂正しました。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, Tadashige DAIGO from the Daigo family joined the Imperial Japanese Navy and was promoted to the vice admiral, with an excellent reputation as the expert of submarines.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 鷹司輔平－鷹司政煕－鷹司政通－鷹司輔煕と継承され、輔煕の跡を九条家九条尚忠の子（鷹司煕道）が継ぎ、男系は途絶えた。
sen.e: Although the Takatsukasa family was succeeded to the following members, Sukehira TAKATSUKASA, Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, Masamichi TAKATSUKASA, and Sukehiro TAKATSUKASA, the male linage died when Terumitchi TAKATSUKASA (the son of Hisatada KUJO of the Kujo family) succeeded the Takatsukasa family from Sukehiro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Although the Takatsukasa family was succeeded to the following members; Sukehira TAKATSUKASA, Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, Masamichi TAKATSUKASA, and Sukehiro TAKATSUKASA, the male linage became extinct when Terumichi TAKATSUKASA (the son of Hisatada KUJO of the Kujo family) succeeded the Takatsukasa family from Sukehiro.
sen.cmt: membersの後のコンマをセミコロンに変えました。 died → became extinct Terumitchi → Terumichi に訂正しました。
sen.e: Although the Takatsukasa family was succeeded to the following members; Sukehira TAKATSUKASA, Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, Masamichi TAKATSUKASA, and Sukehiro TAKATSUKASA, the male linage became extinct when Terumichi TAKATSUKASA (the son of Hisatada KUJO of the Kujo family) succeeded the Takatsukasa family from Sukehiro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、輔平の子（徳大寺実堅）と政通の子（徳大寺公純）が相次いで徳大寺家を相続し、さらに彼らの子孫が多数の華族を相続している。
sen.e: However, Sanemi TOKUDAIJI (the son of Sukehira), succeeded the Tokudaiji family followed by Kinito TOKUDAIJI (the son of Masamichi), and, furthermore their descendants succeeded many of the peerage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Sanekata TOKUDAIJI (the son of Sukehira) succeeded the Tokudaiji family followed by Kinito TOKUDAIJI (the son of Masamichi), and furthermore their descendants succeeded many of the peerages.
sen.cmt: 「実堅」の読みは「さねみ」ではなく「さねかた」です。Sanekata TOKUDAIJI の後のコンマと、futhermore の前のコンマを削除しました。 peerage → peerages
sen.e: However, Sanekata TOKUDAIJI (the son of Sukehira) succeeded the Tokudaiji family followed by Kinito TOKUDAIJI (the son of Masamichi), and furthermore their descendants succeeded many of the peerages.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 明治から大正にかけて2度にわたり内閣総理大臣を務め、退任後元老に列せられた西園寺公望は公純の子である。
sen.e: Kinmochi SAIONJI was the Child of Kinto TOKUDAIJI, who served the prime minister twice, and was later designated to Genro, unofficial advisor to the emperor from Meiji through Taisho Period.

Kinmochi SAIONJI, who served as the prime minister twice and was designated as Genro (unofficial advisor to the emperor) after retirement from Meiji through Taisho Period, was the child of Kinito TOKUDAIJI,.
sen.cmt: Child → child, Kinto → Kinito、served → served as、 designated to → designated as と訂正しました。 訳漏れ：「退任後」を追加しました。 あいまいさをなくし、正確な訳にするため、文構成そのものを変えました。
sen.e: Kinmochi SAIONJI, who served as the prime minister twice and was designated as Genro (unofficial advisor to the emperor) after retirement from Meiji through Taisho Period, was the child of Kinito TOKUDAIJI,.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
